titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bombing of London During World War II Photograph Collection, 1939-1940 SC.1966.01
titlestmt.author: Jennifer Chan.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:52:39 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Bombing of London During World War II Photograph Collection
did.abstract: The Bombing of London during World War II Photograph Collection consists of 143 pictures from the early 1940s that visually document the bombing of London by the Nazis known as "The Blitz." Some are dated while most are not. Images were produced by the Associated Press and Graphic Photo Union.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Transferred from the Fines Art Library to Special Collections in 1966.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The photographs in this collection depict the bombing of London by the Nazis during the period of World War II known collectively as "The Blitz." This period of the intense bombing of London and other cities began on September 7, 1940 and ended May 16, 1941. Adolph Hitler was preparing for a German invasion of England and ordered the Lutwaffe to target RAF airfields and radar stations. Hitler abandoned these plans and executed an air strike to destroy London, demoralize the population, and force England to surrender to his terms. London sustained bombings for 57 consecutive nights, which resulted in the damage and destruction of more than one million London homes. Other important landmarks, such as hospitals, churches, and Buckingham Palace were targeted during the air raids resulting in significant human casualties. The Blitz ended on May 11, 1941 when Hitler called off the raids in order to move his bombers east in preparation for Germany's invasion of Russia.

On the backs of these photographs contain a stamp stating that copyright is attributed to the Associated Press and the Graphic Photo Union. Nearly all photos have detailed captions typed onto paper and glued to the back. Some photos include "PASSED FOR PUBLICATION BY MINISTRY OF INFORMATION" on the back.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Bombing of London During World War II Photograph Collection, 1939-1940, SC.1966.01, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bombing of London During World War II Photograph Collection, 1939-1940, SC.1966.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 143 pictures, taken by the Associated Press during the bombing of London throughout 1940-1941. The photographs are arranged in folders, maintaining the original order and numbering system in which they were received from the Frick Fine Arts Library. The majority of the photographs in this collection measure 8 x 10 inches. However, there are a few of smaller size. Most of the photographs are undated.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Frick Fine Arts Library in 1966.
